snippet: As the Justice Department moved to charge Edward J. Snowden with disclosing classified information, American officials said that he had left a hotel in Hong Kong where he had been holed up for weeks.
abstract: Justice Department officials are moving to charge Edward J Snowden with disclosing classified information about government's surveillance program; Snowden has checked out of Hong Kong hotel where he has been holed up, but it is not clear where he has gone; National Security Agency began trying to identify and locate source of leak after The Guardian broke story.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT, ERIC SCHMITT and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt and Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong. Jonathan Weisman and James Risen contributed reporting from Washington, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: As the Justice Department moved to charge Edward J. Snowden with disclosing classified information, American officials said that he had left a hotel in Hong Kong where he had been holed up for weeks.

headline.seo: Snowden, Facing Charges, Leaves Hong Kong Hotel
headline.main: U.S. Preparing Charges Against Leaker of Data
headline.print_headline: U.S. Preparing Charges Against Leaker of Data

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
